data.title: RigidBody2D fails to apply transforms that would return it to original configuration
data.body: [Here](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/84c8be164b5187c10edf9a1ad04315d094194b34/Source/Urho3D/Urho2D/RigidBody2D.cpp#L600-L603). The code does not agree with the comment when `body_` is not null.

data.title: For CI - create a separate AppVeyor account for Urho3D
data.body: This is a follow up of this discussion https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/1927#issuecomment-299079988.

data.title: Crash: PhysicsWorld2D uses destroyed contact when overlap ceases in broadphase
data.body: When `b2ContactManager` finds that a former contact ceases to overlap, it [destroys the contact](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/84c8be164b5187c10edf9a1ad04315d094194b34/Source/ThirdParty/Box2D/Box2D/Dynamics/b2ContactManager.cpp#L162). Note that [`EndContact` is called](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/84c8be164b5187c10edf9a1ad04315d094194b34/Source/ThirdParty/Box2D/Box2D/Dynamics/b2ContactManager.cpp#L46) on `PhysicsWorld2D`, which saves a pointer to the expiring contact before it is actually destroyed. Later on (but still in the same `PhysicsWorld2D::Update` call) [`PhysicsWorld2D::SendEndContactEvents` is called](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/84c8be164b5187c10edf9a1ad04315d094194b34/Source/Urho3D/Urho2D/PhysicsWorld2D.cpp#L350). This method [tries to serialize the recently destroyed contact into the event](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/84c8be164b5187c10edf9a1ad04315d094194b34/Source/Urho3D/Urho2D/PhysicsWorld2D.cpp#L815), dereferencing rubbish and causing a crash.

data.title: Profiler output is confusing
data.body:
Well, profiling by hand I found that
```c++
world_->stepSimulation(timeStep, maxSubSteps, internalTimeStep);
```
is most time consuming line in Urho I have, it consumes 964 out of 1000 somethings in profiler,
for scene out of 60 RigidBodies (I think Bullet is slowest physical engine I worked with,
but I never seen open source 3D physical engine before). But that is another story.
The profiling block above it,
```c++
URHO3D_PROFILE(UpdatePhysics);
```
correctly indicates the load. But I thought "StepSimulation" block should indicate the load of the above,
but it shows only 80 of 1000 somethings. Which is not informative. Any clues?

data.body:
... and add back on enable if was disabled. If I won't die from work, I'll make it.
But feel free to do it, it should be several lines of code, but huge bucket of happiness!

data.title: Text class should allow per-character subpixel positioning
data.body:
This is another feature suggestion, a followup to #1952 (allow fractional font sizes).

Inspecting both the code and the rendered output, it looks like Text objects align each character to a pixel boundary. That's OK at large sizes but leads to awkward letter spacing at small sizes.

It would be great to align characters horizontally at subpixel offsets, say 1/4 pixel offsets. I think that could be done by extending FontFace to cache up to 4 renderings of each glyph.

That would obviously use more memory, but it's only needed for small fonts, which don't take up much memory in the first place! So we could use an adaptive strategy -- single pixel alignment for large fonts, half-pixel for medium fonts, quarter-pixel for small fonts, etc.

This will become less important as high-resolution screens get more common, but many users still have low-res screens. As Urho aims to be a lightweight framework, it would be good to have high-quality text rendering by default on those low-end devices.

data.title: FontFace should allow fractional font sizes
data.body:
Currently the FontFace class only allows integral sizes (11pt, 12pt, etc).

Internally, FontFaceFreeType multiplies the size by 64, so it looks like FreeType is capable of rendering fonts in steps of 1/64th of a point. It would be good to make that functionality available in Urho. That would make it easier to render crisp text at arbitrary scales.

I'm happy to try implementing this! But I could use some feedback on the best approach:

- Just change pointSize from an int to a float? That changes the API, but I think almost all client code would work unchanged.

- Add new parallel methods that take floats, alongside the existing int methods. Safer but makes the API more complicated.

```
Call Stack (most recent call first):
```

```
  Source/Samples/03_Sprites/CMakeLists.txt:30 (setup_main_executable)
```

I am on linux here, using cmake 3.5.1 and and gcc 5.4.0

data.title: Why does AssetImporter merge model root transfrom and animation root transform?
data.body:
I'm importing animation from *.dae
Root node of model has initial scale.
Here is some branch in AssetImporter
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/97b594de3649541ad9219e86e6f4fcab65b3a300/Source/Tools/AssetImporter/AssetImporter.cpp#L1462
This breaks animation of root node's position (because root position from animation is multiplied with initial scale)
What's the point of this logic?

data.title: Add missing monitor/refresh rate members initialization
For CI - leverage on new Travis CI feature to configure multiple build stages
data.body:
e.g.
- Instead of invoking OSX CI twice during packaging build (the extra one is simply for heating up the cache), we could invoke just once with a pre-stage. This will simplify the CI build script a little bit.
- Instead of configuring the logic to delete the CI mirror branch at the last CI job for each group, the delete logic could be moved to a post-stage. This will eliminate one type of technical error where occasionally the last CI job finish sooner than the rest (which may still be in queue).

data.title: Random seek while playing audio file
data.body:
Hi,

My project uses a huge audio file to play sounds, and I want to play only certain pieces of the audio file.

So I achieved a random seek function to jump to any time while playing, and it supports all audio file types except buffered stream, for buffered stream usually feeds data on the fly.

Usage:
// Jump to 12.5 seconds from beginning.
musicSource->Seek(12.5f);

Regards,

Art

data.title: Help the compiler eliminate calls to strlen at compile time, wherever possible.
data.body:
Also Fix add-assign operator of arbitrary types to return a reference and not a copy.

Normally you would see this using something like `constexpr` but since there's heap memory involved, might have undesired results. However, any decent compiler is able to fold `LiteralStrLen` at compile-time.

I know these kinds of additions are likely to be discarded but I thought I should make a pull request anyway.

Performance wise, I opened the Character demo and left it on idle after I pressed F2 to bring the debug text (so there's some actual text being used). Without this, the CPU was averaging around 19-21% and with it, around 8-10%. Might have to run some further tests to see how much (if any) performance is gained.

I've tried this with MinGW 7.1 x64. Although, theoretically, the code should be C++98 compatible.

data.title: Objects with same Model+Material keep disappearing and reappearing
data.body:
It would appear that objects that have the same Model and Material disappear and reappear as the camera is moved. I suspect this is a bug with builtin instancing.

A workaround is to clone either the model or the material.

MCVE (with the workaround demonstrated): https://gist.github.com/darkuranium/a75853e7c99e57bcbc12f3d0c5b1b670 ; the models & materials are the same ones that come distributed with Urho3D.

Videos of the problem (*NOTE 1&2): https://stdrand.com/data/Urho3D/

This happens both with 1.6 *and* master. I've no idea how to get the device information from the Renderer, so I cannot provide that info at the moment.

*NOTE 1: Note how the wireframe video has a small line show up on the left side as the sphere disappears and vice-versa. I suspect the data is somehow misinterpreted.
*NOTE 2: I can't promise I'll keep the videos up forever, as this is my personal server.

data.title: Black window.
data.body:
I've just started with Urho3D, but there is some problems. I've created minimal black window without anyting, now I just try draw some text or sprite, but window still empty.

Step by step:
1. I've cloned Urho3D https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D.git and added C:/path_to_urho/Urho3D to Path environment variable

2. I built engine with command:
`cd C:/path_to_urho/Urho3D`
`cmake_vs2015.bat Build -DURHO3D_OPENGL=ON -DURHO3D_SAMPLES=ON -DURHO3D_STATIC_RUNTIME=ON`

3. After that I opened Urho3D.sln that was generated in Build subfolder, and build solution ALL_BUILD in Debug and Release 

4. I created my own project (https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_using_library.html),
I used this command:
`cmake CMakeLists.txt -DURHO3D_OPENGL=ON -DURHO3D_SAMPLES=ON -DURHO3D_STATIC_RUNTIME=ON`
and I tried use some part of code in my minimal window, but window stay same empty. After this I tried to copy sample's sources from /Urho3D/Source/Samples/Sample.h, Sample.inl and /Urho3D/Source/Samples/HelloWorld.h, HelloWorld.cpp to my project directory, but there is still no effect, my window still black and empty.

In debug Microsoft Visual Studio ouput shows tons of messages like this:

> Urho3D_d.lib(SDL_syscond.obj) : warning LNK4099: "SDL.pdb" PDB not found "Urho3D_d.lib(SDL_syscond.obj)"
...
...

> Urho3D_d.lib(btBoxShape.obj) : warning LNK4099: "Bullet.pdb" PDB не найден с "Urho3D_d.lib(btBoxShape.obj)"
...

How can I fix this problem, print some text and draw something in my window?

data.title: Platform-specific system query functions
data.body:
Continuation of PR #1931 

Looks good on my machine. Only supports Windows and Linux platform at the moment. The Windows API used requires Windows 2000 Pro/XP or higher. 

![](http://i.imgur.com/uVEoT6q.jpg)

data.title: Bullet bug: Assert !fuzzyZero() in line 300, file Bullet/src/LinearMath/btVector3.h
Add Object::IsTypeOf to AngelScript API.
data.body:
It could be useful in some cases. For example in my game I have abstract `Unit` component and it's implementations: `FleetUnit`, `TradersUnit`, `ColonizatorsUnit` and `ArmyUnit`. And if have an array of `Unit`'s, this function is only one way to determinate which unit type is it.
P.S. I don't know, how to make same lua binding without changing C++ `Object` code.

data.title: Query the amount of installed memory
data.body: Only works on Linux and Windows atm. (I don't have access to other platforms for proper testing).
